pitrou commented on issue #6585: ARROW-8080: [C++] Add ARROW_AVX512 build option
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6585#issuecomment-598119264
 
 
   I'm not sure what our policy should be on such options. On the one hand, we already have an option to enable SSE4.2 (but it's always on anyway, since most x86 CPUs less than 10 years old support it). On the other hand, passing compiler options can already be done by passing `CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS` and/org `ARROW_CXXFLAGS`, so it doesn't seem very useful to be adding dedicated options for each optimization flag.
   
   Also, AVX512 is actually comprised of a lot of subsets (Wikipedia lists them: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AVX-512#Instruction_set). It seems this option would enable the "AVX-512 Foundation" instructions, which is probably the baseline.
   
   @emkornfield @wesm Thoughts?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on pull request #6585: ARROW-8080: [C++] Add ARROW_AVX512 build option
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6585#discussion_r391799492
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/SetupCxxFlags.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -270,6 +271,10 @@ if(CXX_SUPPORTS_SSE4_2 AND ARROW_SSE42)
   set(CXX_COMMON_FLAGS "${CXX_COMMON_FLAGS} -msse4.2")
 endif()
 
+if(CXX_SUPPORTS_AVX512 AND ARROW_AVX512)
+  set(CXX_COMMON_FLAGS "${CXX_COMMON_FLAGS} -march=skylake-avx512")
 
 Review comment:
   This is not the same as `-mavx512f` above.

jianxind commented on pull request #6585: ARROW-8080: [C++] Add ARROW_AVX512 build option
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6585#discussion_r391972450
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/SetupCxxFlags.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -270,6 +271,10 @@ if(CXX_SUPPORTS_SSE4_2 AND ARROW_SSE42)
   set(CXX_COMMON_FLAGS "${CXX_COMMON_FLAGS} -msse4.2")
 endif()
 
+if(CXX_SUPPORTS_AVX512 AND ARROW_AVX512)
+  set(CXX_COMMON_FLAGS "${CXX_COMMON_FLAGS} -march=skylake-avx512")
 
 Review comment:
   skylake-avx512 is a combined options which include basic AVX512 subsets for most AVX512 capable machines. The check_cxx_compiler_flag can only inspect the single define.
   
   echo | gcc -dM -E - -march=skylake-avx512 | grep AVX512
   #define __AVX512F__ 1
   #define __AVX512BW__ 1
   #define __AVX512VL__ 1
   #define __AVX512CD__ 1
   #define __AVX512DQ__ 1
   
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

jianxind commented on issue #6585: ARROW-8080: [C++] Add ARROW_AVX512 build option
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6585#issuecomment-598494867
 
 
   > I'm having a hard time finding clear documentation about avx512-related compiler options. Is `skylake-avx512` the only one?
   
   Yeah, skylake-avx512 is a collection option which include AVX512F, AVX512BW, AVX512VL, AVX512CD, AVX512DQ subset. These five are the most supported for latest devices(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AVX-512#CPUs_with_AVX-512)
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

users@infra.apache.org

emkornfield commented on issue #6585: ARROW-8080: [C++] Add ARROW_AVX512 build option
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6585#issuecomment-598565031
 
 
   I don't feel strongly but it feels like we should be trying to keep the CMake file optimizations for the most common platform options that we need for packaging/CI, additional CPU options like this seem like they should mostly be passed through CXX_* args by expert users who need the extra performance, until we are ready to run regular tests in CI.  Even then I could see the argument of still passing them via CXX_* flags.  I'm happy to listen to reasonable arguments for why these should be included and other rubrics for deciding what to include.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

jianxind commented on issue #6585: ARROW-8080: [C++] Add ARROW_AVX512 build option
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6585#issuecomment-598594636
 
 
   > I don't feel strongly but it feels like we should be trying to keep the CMake file optimizations for the most common platform options that we need for packaging/CI, additional CPU options like this seem like they should mostly be passed through CXX_* args by expert users who need the extra performance, until we are ready to run regular tests in CI. Even then I could see the argument of still passing them via CXX_* flags. I'm happy to listen to reasonable arguments for why these should be included and other rubrics for deciding what to include.
   
   Yeah, it can pass additional options by CXX flags for expert anyway. For other new guys who don't want to play with the detail compiler AVX512 options, it could just simple the out-of-box usage if arrow has a built-in option already.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

pitrou commented on issue #6585: ARROW-8080: [C++] Add ARROW_AVX512 build option
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6585#issuecomment-598655218
 
 
   I'll note that it can be a bad idea to enable AVX512, since it can cause frequency drops that aren't offset by the per-cycle performance gain:
   https://reviews.llvm.org/D67259
   
   So we should probably leave it to experts anyway and avoid lure people into enabling it.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

jianxind commented on issue #6585: ARROW-8080: [C++] Add ARROW_AVX512 build option
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6585#issuecomment-598729707
 
 
   Attached the data on a "Intel® Xeon® Platinum 8280L" server with the mirco-benchmarks build by "DARROW_BUILD_BENCHMARKS", filter data shows ~70 positive(>1.1) improvements while other ~20 indicators shows regression(<0.9). Basically the overall results give a positive achievements with only leverage the compiler feature. I guess there could be more space to improve the performance on AVX512 if some critical path can be modified to use avx intrinsics API, https://software.intel.com/sites/landingpage/IntrinsicsGuide/
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

   [512 vs default on CLK.xlsx](https://github.com/apache/arrow/files/4329904/512.vs.default.on.CLK.xlsx)
   Attached the data on a "Intel® Xeon® Platinum 8280L" server with the mirco-benchmarks build by "DARROW_BUILD_BENCHMARKS", filter data shows ~70 positive(>1.1) improvements while other ~20 indicators shows regression(<0.9). Basically the overall results give a positive achievements with only leverage the compiler feature. I guess there could be more space to improve the performance on AVX512 if some critical path can be modified to use avx intrinsics API, https://software.intel.com/sites/landingpage/IntrinsicsGuide/

fields.description: Introduce a build option(ARROW_AVX512) to utilize the compiler feature for AVX512 machine.
